title: You Are Not So Smart by David McRaney
description:
An entertaining illumination of the stupid beliefs that make us feel wise, based on the popular blog of the same name. 

Whether youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re deciding which smartphone to purchase or which politician to believe, you think you are a rational being whose every decision is based on cool, detached logic. But hereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the truth: You are not so smart. YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re just as deluded as the rest of usÃ¢â‚¬â€but thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s okay, because being deluded is part of being human. 

Growing out of David McRaneyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s popular blog, You Are Not So Smart reveals that every decision we make, every thought we contemplate, and every emotion we feel comes with a story we tell ourselves to explain them. But often these stories arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t true. Each short chapterÃ¢â‚¬â€covering topics such as Learned Helplessness, Selling Out, and the Illusion of TransparencyÃ¢â‚¬â€is like a psychology course with all the boring parts taken out. 

Bringing together popular science and psychology with humor and wit, You Are Not So Smart is a celebration of our irrational, thoroughly human behavior.
